description.narrative: Save the Children Sweden’s (SCS) Child Right’s Program addresses children’s’ rights in terms of child right’s governance, child protection and children’s security in relation to HIV/Aids.

Rädda Barnens Child Rights Program syftar till att främja rättigheter och möjligheter för ett effektivt deltagande för barn, och en ökad medvetenhet om sina rättigheter i linje med FN: s barnkonvention och ACRWC. Programmet fungerar i tre områden nämligen barn rätt styrnings; skydd av barn; och barns säkerhet i förhållande till HIV / Aids. Strategier som används innefattar direkt programmering; kapacitetsuppbyggnad av partner; gruppmedlemmar och tull bärare; ökad medvetenhet bland nyckelaktörer som lärare, föräldrar, traditionella ledare och mer; opinionsbildning för att lobba på politikerna för en barnvänlig lagstiftning och budget spårning; barns deltagande för att säkerställa att verksamheten speglar barnperspektivet ; och forskning och dokumentation för att övervaka situationen för barn och för att öka medvetenheten om barns rättigheter. Programmet är en del av SCI Zambia program som bygger på tidigare arbete inom samma geografiska platser.

Save the Children's Child Rights Program is aimed at promoting rights and possibilities for effective participation for children, and increased awareness of their rights in line with the UNCRC and the ACRWC. The program works in three areas namely child right's governance; child protection; and children's security in relation to HIV/Aids. Strategies used include direct programming; capacity building of partners; community members and duty bearers; awareness raising among key stakeholders such as teachers, parents, traditional leaders and more; advocacy to lobby on politicians for a child friendly legislative framework and budget tracking; child participation to ensure that the activities reflect the child perspective; and research and documentation to monitor the situation of children and to raise the awareness of children’s rights. The program is part of SCI Zambia program which builds on previous work in the same geographical locations.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The support to Save the Children had three programmes namely, Child Rights Governance, Child Protection & HIV/AIDS. The following are examples of results achieved or to which Save the Children contributed during the duration of the support. Child Rights Governance - Domestication of some provisions of the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child (CRC) as well as the inclusion of the definition of a child in the 2016 amended constitution - Development of key legislation such the draft Child Code Bill - Development of the National Plan of Action for the National Child Policy Child Protection - Strengtening of the referral system in relation to the Child Helpline. More than 1,200,000 children were reached with 68,900 receiving expert counseling and further referral - Establishment and strengthening of Community Child Protection Committees across implementing sites leading to improved commmunity response and linkages in case identification, reporting and counseling HIV/AIDS - Uptake of sexual and reproductive health and HIV services increased from below 3200 to 92,780 in the intervention sites. At one clinic in Kabwe, the youth access went from a monthly average of 12 when the project started to an average of 171 by October 2017. - Increase of functioning youth friendly corners from 30 to 135
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
